intro: Caraguata sanguinea var. erecta, commonly known as the red caraguata, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and striking red flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hairy seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture and botanical gardens.
